channel.title: Keyboard on Halogenica
channel.description: Recent content in Keyboard on Halogenica

item.title: Custom Keyboard - DZ65RGB
item.author: mike@halogenica.net (Michael Romero)
item.description: My previous TADA68 build mysteriously bit the dust, so I decided to build a new keyboard and reuse my TADA68 aluminum case. Thankfully I found a fantastic (nearly) drop-in repalcement PCB: the DZ65RGB. It is another 65% keyboard like the TADA68, and has my most desired improvements over the TADA68: individually addressible RGB LEDs, USB-C, hot-swappable switches, and a lovely purple and gold color scheme!

item.title: Custom Keyboard - TADA68
item.author: mike@halogenica.net (Michael Romero)
item.description: As I learned more about the world of mechanical keyboards, I wanted to experiment with new switches, play with new keycaps, and most importantly try my hand at building my own.
